title: I need to prepare a declaration for the chapter 7 trustee as to why / that I haven't filed taxes last year (and other years),how
question: When I told the trustee at the meeting that I didn't file taxes because I was unemployed, he said for me to get him a signed declaration.
answers: There is a standard form for this. Go to the court's website (sounds like you filed your Chapter 7 on your own, so it will be in the same place where you got all the other forms), and look for a form called Declaration re: Tax Returns (or something similar). If you can't find it feel free to contact me and I will send it to you.

You have the form and suggested content of your declaration from above. The attached website will tell you if you meet the requirements or suggested process if you choose NOT TO FILE...

http://www.irs.gov/individuals/article/0,,id=96623,00.html

Have a statement written up starting with "I, (your name) state under the penalties of perjury that I have not filed tax forms since (fill in here) because I do not get income that would require me to file taxes."

Have that signed by a notary and send it to the Trustee.

Your trustee is required to verify that you have filed all necessary income tax returns as part of his job. He is just trying to create a paper trail that proves why you did not file.

When we write such a Declaration for a client, we do use pleading paper and file it with the Court as well.

Whether you will need to do it that way very much depends on your Trustee. You could write a simple letter that states you did not file and why and send that in to the Trustee, asking if it will be sufficient. His office should be able to tell you if such a letter is ok and give you some idea as to what the Trustee expects.
